channel.title: Anyone interested in flying some internet spaceships?
channel.description:
I recently started playing Eve again... anyone wanna join me?
PM or post here if you want a 21day invite (the one on the site is 14 days). If you subscribe from my invite I get free playtime, so I will send anyone who uses my invite ingame money to get them started as a thankyou.
Hit me up ingame if you need any help with anything at all.
Common Misconceptions (Inspired by eXemplar) * [i]Wahhh Eve is really boring.[/i] - Don't be misled by the tutorial. To combat Eve's reputation for being too hard, they made the tutorial really easy (and boring as fuck). If it bores you that much, just don't do it all. The basics are worth doing for knowledge, and the rest is definitely worth doing for the free stuff you get (even ships), but if you're really bored, just leave it. * [i]Wahhh Eve is really hard.[/i] - Nah, it's not. It's a deep and complex game, but if you don't give a fuck about weapon falloff and transversal velocities and whatnot you can get along just fine without giving a fuck. * [i]Wahhh it will be ages before I can do anything.[/i] - Untrue. Because of the realtime skill system, it is true of course that you will never catch up in pure SP with the old timers, unless they quit. But you don't have to. Eve's skill system works kind of like RS's, without combat levels. That is to say, there is a bunch of little skills you train, and no "main level" restriction. If you want some pvp, we could get a couple people in a basic rifter fit in like 2 days and go do some pirate action or w/e. It actaully takes LESS time to do fun stuff than other MMOs.
Persuade persuade bother bother. I wanna fly with some of my MITB niggaz.

item.title: Anyone interested in flying some internet spaceships?
item.dc:creator: @Budda Budda
item.description:
@Budda wrote:

Mopman:

This would be what I meant when I said the tutorial does a horrible job of actually getting you into the game.

So you actually gonna send invite, or just talk about it

Read full topic

I recently started playing Eve again… anyone wanna join me?

The basics are worth doing for knowledge, and the rest is definitely worth doing for the free stuff you get (even ships), but if you’re really bored, just leave it.
  • Wahhh Eve is really hard. - Nah, it’s not. It’s a deep and complex game, but if you don’t give a fuck about weapon falloff and transversal velocities and whatnot you can get along just fine without giving a fuck.
  • Wahhh it will be ages before I can do anything. - Untrue. Because of the realtime skill system, it is true of course that you will never catch up in pure SP with the old timers, unless they quit. But you don’t have to. Eve’s skill system works kind of like RS’s, without combat levels. That is to say, there is a bunch of little skills you train, and no “main level” restriction. If you want some pvp, we could get a couple people in a basic rifter fit in like 2 days and go do some pirate action or w/e. It actaully takes LESS time to do fun stuff than other MMOs.
